Package simple.gui

Class Slider

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.gui.Widget
      • simple.gui.Slider

  • public class Slider
extends Widget
    Silder widget class. Creates a slider object with minimum and maximum integer values. Value of the slider depends on where the mouse was last clicking on the slider. Value starts at the minimum, and can be adjusted manually.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Slider

        public Slider​(int low,
              int high,
              boolean isRev,
              boolean isHoriz)
        Creates a new slider object with no given dimensions
        Parameters:
        low - Sets lower boundary for slider value
        high - Sets upper boundary for slider value
        isRev - Sets what end of the slider is high and what is low.
        isHoriz - Sets what the orientation of the slider is.

      • Slider

        public Slider​(int x,
              int y,
              int w,
              int h,
              int low,
              int high,
              boolean isRev,
              boolean isHoriz)
        Creates a new slider object with the given dimensions
        Parameters:
        low - Sets lower boundary for slider value
        high - Sets upper boundary for slider value
        isRev - Sets what end of the slider is high and what is low.
        isHoriz - Sets what the orientation of the slider is.

        public boolean valueChanged​()
        Returns whether or not the value of the slider has changed since last frame

      • setValue

        public void setValue​(int value)
        Sets the current value of the slider. Value is bounded within [low, high]

      • setRange

        public void setRange​(int low,
                     int high)
        Sets the new range for the slider. If newHigh is greater than newLow, they will switch. Value is bounded by [newLow, newHigh]

      • setMouseCanScroll

        public void setMouseCanScroll​(boolean mouseCanScroll)
        Enables or disables ability to scroll with mouse wheel

        Sets mouse wheel scroll value increment
